analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is a homage because it is clear and realized.

original: slob dpon chen po klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i rim pa lnga pa las kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po klu sgrub kyis mdzad pa'i rim pa lnga pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Five Stages composed by the great master Nagarjuna:

original: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang gis rang gi ye shes ni //
translated: The one who sees his own intuition

original: legs mthong gang yin 'dir phyag yin //
analyzed: legs mthong gang yin 'dir phyag yin //
translated: is here the one who makes homage.

original: slob dpon sh'akya bshes gnyen gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon sh'akya bshes gnyen gyis gsungs so //
translated: This is stated by the master Shakya Guna.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gdan la bzhugs tsam na phyag 'tshal bar don gyis shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje gdan la bzhugs tsam na phyag 'tshal bar don gyis shes par bya'o ;
translated: And that homage should be understood as referring to the time when the Lord was just sitting on the vajra seat.

original: / sa la lta ba ni lan glan pas mi thegs pa'i phyir sa la lta zhig gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / sa la lta ba ni lan glan pas mi thegs pa'i phyir sa la lta zhig gnas pa'o //
translated: Looking at the ground means looking at the ground, standing there, because one cannot respond to the question.

original: cang mi smra bar zhes pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin dga' ba la brjod pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir mi smra bar 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: cang mi smra bar zhes pa ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin dga' ba la brjod pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir mi smra bar 'dug pa'o //
translated: Staying silent means staying silent because the nature of the ultimate, the joy, transcends all things, such as speech.

original: de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyag 'tshal ba'i dus so ;
analyzed: de'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyag 'tshal ba'i dus so ;
translated: The time and so forth refers to the time of the homage.

original: / nam mkha' la ni par snang stong pa la zhes pa bshad do //
analyzed: / nam mkha' la ni par snang stong pa la zhes pa bshad do //
translated: The empty space is explained as the empty space of the empty sky.

original: mand'a ra ba zhes bya ba ni me tog sna tshogs dang rin po che la sogs mang bo sprul pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mand'a ra ba zhes bya ba ni me tog sna tshogs dang rin po che la sogs mang bo sprul pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The mandƒÅrava and so forth refers to the offering of emanations of various flowers, jewels, and so forth.

original: yang na nam mkha' ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rtsa'i mkha'o //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i rtsa'i mkha'o //
translated: Alternatively, space is the space of the channels of the great-bliss cakra, and so forth.

original: manda ra ba dang mandh'a ba chan po zhes pa la sogs pa ni rtsa'i mkha' stong pa'i gnas na rlung bcu la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: manda ra ba dang mandh'a ba chan po zhes pa la sogs pa ni rtsa'i mkha' stong pa'i gnas na rlung bcu la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: The great mandƒÅrava and so forth refers to the ten vƒÅyus and so forth in the empty space of the channels.

original: dri chen po me tog dang ldan zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i dri dang rlung de rnams dang ldan nas nam mkha' nas 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: dri chen po me tog dang ldan zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i dri dang rlung de rnams dang ldan nas nam mkha' nas 'bab pa'o //
translated: The great scent of flowers refers to the scent of bliss of bodhicitta, which is endowed with those vƒÅyus and descends from the space.

original: de yang zhabs kyi rtsa bar ba po zhes te /
analyzed: de yang zhabs kyi rtsa bar ba po zhes te /
translated: That is also at the foot, which means

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs zhes go bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs zhes go bar bya'o //
translated: at the foot of the BhagavƒÅn, which is to be understood.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bos te zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar lan med pas de la yang mtshan skyes nas phyi nas yang bskyar nas lha'i dbang phyug la bos pa'o //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bos te zhes pa la sogs pa ni sngar lan med pas de la yang mtshan skyes nas phyi nas yang bskyar nas lha'i dbang phyug la bos pa'o //
translated: Again, the Blessed One called out, and so forth means that since there was no reply before, he again called out to the Lord of Gods after the name was born.

original: lha'i dbang phyug gis gsol pa zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i dbang phyug gis gsol pa zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa'o //
translated: The request of the Lord of Gods is the request to the Blessed One.

original: de yang 'di skad bstan to //
analyzed: de yang 'di skad bstan to //
translated: That is also explained as follows:

original: @162a * // bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni mtshan mnga' dngos po la sogs pa'i brjod pa yang med dam ci zhes so //
analyzed: @162a * // bcom ldan 'das de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni mtshan mnga' dngos po la sogs pa'i brjod pa yang med dam ci zhes so //
translated: The Blessed One's three suchnesses and so forth means that there is no expression of name, entity, and so forth. Is that so?

original: de la bdag ya mtshan du gyur to zhes pa ni mtshan ma dang dngos po la sogs pa med pa la ni mtshan la sogs pa'i dngos por gsungs pa la ni ya mtshan skyes pa'o //üîΩae ma'o ni ya mtshan skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag ya mtshan du gyur to zhes pa ni mtshan ma dang dngos po la sogs pa med pa la ni mtshan la sogs pa'i dngos por gsungs pa la ni ya mtshan skyes pa'o // ae ma'o ni ya mtshan skyes pa'o //
translated: Here, I was amazed means that since there is no name, entity, and so forth, I was amazed by the teaching of name and so forth as an entity.üîΩAmazing means amazement.

original: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o ni ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'o //
translated: Amazing means marvelous.

original: dpa' bo ni gdug pa thams cad la sogs pa 'joms pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni gdug pa thams cad la sogs pa 'joms pa'i bdag nyid do zhes pa'o //
translated: The hero is the nature of the conqueror of all the wicked.

original: chen po zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa dang sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa la bya'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mdzad pa dang sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa la bya'o //
translated: The great is to be taken as the one who performs the benefit of sentient beings and is adorned with the great qualities of a Buddha.

original: lha'i dbang phyug ni sngar gyis don de rnams ldan pa mtshan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bos pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i dbang phyug ni sngar gyis don de rnams ldan pa mtshan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bos pa'o //
translated: The Lord of gods is the one who possesses those previously mentioned meanings.

original: mchog gi rdo rje 'dzin pas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po mchog tu gyur pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i sku rdo rje de'i ngang ma g-yengs par 'dzin pas ni byed pa por brjod do //
analyzed: mchog gi rdo rje 'dzin pas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po mchog tu gyur pa dbyer mi phyed pa'i sku rdo rje de'i ngang ma g-yengs par 'dzin pas ni byed pa por brjod do //
translated: The supreme vajra-holder is the one who holds the essence of the Tathagata, the supreme, indivisible body of vajra, without distraction from that state.

original: 'di gsungs so zhes pa ni 'og na mar 'byung ba 'di'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so zhes pa ni 'og na mar 'byung ba 'di'i zhes bshad do //
translated: He spoke this is explained as ‚Äúthis‚Äù that will be taught below.

original: de yang 'di skad du bstan te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad du bstan te /
translated: And that is taught as follows.

original: de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa ni ae dang wam dang m'a dan gsum zhes par dgongs so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa ni ae dang wam dang m'a dan gsum zhes par dgongs so //
translated: The three realities are the three, E, VAM, and MA.

original: bdag nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pa nas tshad ces pa'i bar ni med dam ci zhes pa ni ya la sogs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zhes pa la sogs pa nas tshad ces pa'i bar ni med dam ci zhes pa ni ya la sogs par bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase of the self and so on up to measure is explained as what? and so on.

original: de yang 'di skad ces pa nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i bar gyis shes par bya //
analyzed: de yang 'di skad ces pa nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa'i bar gyis shes par bya //
translated: And that is to be understood by the passage beginning with thus and ending with Blessed One.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mi gsungs ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa mi gsungs ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: But why is it not said of the Tathagatas and so on?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams ni der 'dus pa dang / de kho na la sogs pa'i don rtogs pas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams ni der 'dus pa dang / de kho na la sogs pa'i don rtogs pas thams cad rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The retinue of the Tathagatas and so on is assembled there, and they all understand, because they have realized the meaning of thatness and so on.

original: de ltar yang ni byang chub sems dpa' lha'i dbang phyug khyod bden de bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ni byang chub sems dpa' lha'i dbang phyug khyod bden de bya'o //
translated: And so, the Bodhisattva, the Lord of Gods, said, It is so, it is so!

original: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos te phyi nang gis bsdus pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos te phyi nang gis bsdus pa'i chos so //
translated: All phenomena are conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, phenomena included in the internal and external.

original: kyi zhes pa ni zlas dgar ba'o //
analyzed: kyi zhes pa ni zlas dgar ba'o //
translated: The word of is a conjunction.

original: ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi zhes pa ni 'dus byas la sogs pa'i chos ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o //üîΩ'di ga las shes zhes pa ni tha snyad dang bral ba'i don ni brjod pa dang rtogs pa zhes shes su mi rung ste de bas na ga las shes mig yor tsam gyi rgyu rten ni kun rdzob kyi bden ba sgyu ma'am mig yor tsam du snang ba
analyzed: ngo bo stong pa nyid kyi zhes pa ni 'dus byas la sogs pa'i chos ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa don dam pa'i bden pa'o // 'di ga las shes zhes pa ni tha snyad dang bral ba'i don ni brjod pa dang rtogs pa zhes shes su mi rung ste de bas na ga las shes mig yor tsam gyi rgyu rten ni kun rdzob kyi bden ba sgyu ma'am mig yor tsam du snang ba
translated: The emptiness of the entity of the compounded, etc. is the ultimate truth.

original: la brten nas shes @162b par bya'o //
analyzed: la brten nas shes @162b par bya'o //
translated: How is this known? The meaning that is free from convention is not suitable to be known as expression and realization. Therefore, how is it known? The mere reflection-like cause and support is the conventional truth. It is to be known in dependence on the appearance that is mere illusion or reflection.

original: chos thams cad ces pa sngar gyi chos te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces pa sngar gyi chos te /
translated: All phenomena are the phenomena mentioned above.

original: rten dang rten can no //
analyzed: rten dang rten can no //
translated: They are the support and the supported.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni mthun pa'i dpe yis don shes par ston no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni mthun pa'i dpe yis don shes par ston no //
translated: How is this known? The meaning is taught by a concordant example.

original: gla rtsi la brten nas dri la gla rtsi dngos po med na /
analyzed: gla rtsi la brten nas dri la gla rtsi dngos po med na /
translated: In dependence on the musk, the scent is not an entity of the musk.

original: dri rnyid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dri rnyid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs te /
translated: How could the scent be spoiled?

original: de ni dpe gla rtsi dngos po sra ba la ma brten par dngos po med pa'i dri stong pa mi rnyed do zhes so //
analyzed: de ni dpe gla rtsi dngos po sra ba la ma brten par dngos po med pa'i dri stong pa mi rnyed do zhes so //
translated: The example is that without depending on the entity of the musk, which is a solid thing, the scent, which is not a thing, is not found to be empty.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob sgyur ma tsam gyi bden pa lam brten par don dam pa'i bden pa mi rnyed do zhes pa'i do to //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob sgyur ma tsam gyi bden pa lam brten par don dam pa'i bden pa mi rnyed do zhes pa'i do to //
translated: Likewise, ultimate truth is not found without relying on the truth of mere conventional deception.

original: de yang lung las /
analyzed: de yang lung las /
translated: And that is stated in scripture:

original: bskyed pa'i skul brten nas ni //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i skul brten nas ni //
translated: Having relied on the generated body,

original: tha mal pa yi bag chags sbyong //
analyzed: tha mal pa yi bag chags sbyong //
translated: the habitual tendencies of the ordinary are purified.

original: de yang bdag gi de nyid de //üîΩbdag shes pa ni bde chen sku //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi de nyid de // bdag shes pa ni bde chen sku //
translated: And that is the reality of the self,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: the knowledge of the self is the body of great bliss.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni gla rtsi la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob la brten dgos par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni gla rtsi la sogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob la brten dgos par bstan to //
translated: Likewise means that it is taught that one must rely on the conventional, like musk and so on.

original: rang gi ngo pos sa dang tshad kyis dang rnam pa'i zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems la ma brten par ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems mi rnyed ces so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo pos sa dang tshad kyis dang rnam pa'i zhes pa ni kun rdzob kyi byang chub sems la ma brten par ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems mi rnyed ces so //
translated: One's own nature, level, measure, and aspect means that without relying on the conventional bodhicitta, ultimate bodhicitta is not found.

original: dper na chu med par nya tshol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu med par nya tshol ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like searching for a fish without water.

original: de kho na nyid gsum ni sku rdo rje dang gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid gsum ni sku rdo rje dang gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three realities are the three: the vajra body, the vajra speech, and the vajra mind.

original: bdag nyid ces pa gsum po'i don ma nor bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa gsum po'i don ma nor bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: The self is the unerring realization of the meaning of the three.

original: zla ba de mchog ces pa ni sngar thos pa bshad pa de phung po lnga dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba de mchog ces pa ni sngar thos pa bshad pa de phung po lnga dang skye mched dang khams la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The moon is the supreme, which is the previously explained hearing, to be known as the nature of the buddhas and so on, the aggregates, sense bases, elements, and so on.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i sku zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin bdag la rang chas su gnas pa'i rdo rje snying po'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i sku zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin bdag la rang chas su gnas pa'i rdo rje snying po'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The mahƒÅmudrƒÅ kƒÅya is the nature of the gnosis being, the essence of the vajra heart that abides in oneself by nature.

original: yang na de kho na nyid gsum ni rlung gi 'khor lo dang / me'i dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo dang gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na de kho na nyid gsum ni rlung gi 'khor lo dang / me'i dang / sprul pa'i 'khor lo dang gsum mo //
translated: Alternatively, the three realities are the wind ma·πá·∏çala, the fire ma·πá·∏çala, and the emanation ma·πá·∏çala.

original: zla ba bde mchog ni longs spyod 'khor lo'i phyag rgya chen po'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: zla ba bde mchog ni longs spyod 'khor lo'i phyag rgya chen po'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The moon is the supreme enjoyment ma·πá·∏çala.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo la ni spyi thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo la ni spyi thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: The dharma ma·πá·∏çala is applied to all in general.

original: yang de ko na nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni char yang la sogs par bstan te /
analyzed: yang de ko na nyid ces pa la sogs pa ni char yang la sogs par bstan te /
translated: Again, that and so on are explained as and so on.

original: de rnams la brten nas don dam rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams la brten nas don dam rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: and on the basis of those, the ultimate will be found.

original: stong bas ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: stong bas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so with emptiness.

original: de yang rgyu byed pa dang 'byung ba dang / brten pa dang gnas pas ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i don 'byung ba'o //üîΩyang na de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni thabs dang shes rab sbyor pa'i dus su bya gdong gi gnas btsal nas rin po che'i kha la ri bong can thigs pa gcig gis rin chen @163a * //
analyzed: de yang rgyu byed pa dang 'byung ba dang / brten pa dang gnas pas ni dga' ba la sogs pa'i don 'byung ba'o // yang na de kho na nyid gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni thabs dang shes rab sbyor pa'i dus su bya gdong gi gnas btsal nas rin po che'i kha la ri bong can thigs pa gcig gis rin chen @163a * //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the arising of joy and so forth is by the cause, the arising, the support, and the abiding.

original: khar gnas pa dang / bya gdong la thal ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i bar na gsal ba'o zhes badzra bo dhi'i man ngag go //
analyzed: khar gnas pa dang / bya gdong la thal ba dang / gnyis su med pa'i bar na gsal ba'o zhes badzra bo dhi'i man ngag go //
translated: Or else, the three realities and so forth, at the time of the union of means and insight, having sought the place of the bird-face, the moon in the mouth of the jewel, with a single drop, abides in the jewel mouth, and on the bird-face, the ash, and in between the non-dual, is clear. This is the instruction of Vajrodbhava.

original: de gsum ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig par bshad do //
analyzed: de gsum ni sems dang sems las byung ba dang ma rig par bshad do //
translated: Those three are explained as mind, mental factors, and ignorance.

original: de bas na zhes pa ni de dang de las da byung zhes pa'i don bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa ni de dang de las da byung zhes pa'i don bstan pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, and so forth, the meaning of ‚Äúarising from that and that‚Äù is taught.

original: / de yang 'di skad bshad do //
analyzed: / de yang 'di skad bshad do //
translated: And that is explained as follows.

original: khyab dang khyab byed bye brag tu //
analyzed: khyab dang khyab byed bye brag tu //
translated: The pervader and the pervaded are distinguished.

original: gnyis su med pa'i bde ba che //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i bde ba che //
translated: Is the great bliss of nonduality.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dang kun rdzob byang chub sems gnyis las rang bzhin gyis bde ba chen po 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub sems dang kun rdzob byang chub sems gnyis las rang bzhin gyis bde ba chen po 'byung bar bstan to //
translated: From the two, ultimate bodhicitta and relative bodhicitta, the great bliss of the nature arises.

original: thams cad ces pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù refers to mundane and supramundane phenomena.

original: gnyis su ni so sor gnas pa la dbye bar bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis su ni so sor gnas pa la dbye bar bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo‚Äù refers to the division into individual states.

original: med pa'i zhes pa ni gnyis su snang ba'i chos rnams dbyer mi phyed pa'i ngang du gcig pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i zhes pa ni gnyis su snang ba'i chos rnams dbyer mi phyed pa'i ngang du gcig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNondual‚Äù means that all phenomena that appear as dual are one in the state of indivisibility.

original: dngos zhes pa ni dbyer mi phyed pa la dngos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos zhes pa ni dbyer mi phyed pa la dngos zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEntity‚Äù refers to indivisibility.

original: de yang thabs dang shes rab tha dad pa //
analyzed: de yang thabs dang shes rab tha dad pa //
translated: Furthermore, method and wisdom are different.

original: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo ru //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i ngo bo ru //
translated: The essence of the support and the supported

original: de gnyis gcig gi don du mnyam //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig gi don du mnyam //
translated: are equal in the meaning of the two being one.

original: gang gis rtogs pa gnyis med dngos //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs pa gnyis med dngos //
translated: Whoever realizes the nondual entity

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: is a yogin of the great yoga.

original: gzhan yang / dbyer med brtag pa'i dngos grub ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbyer med brtag pa'i dngos grub ni /
translated: Furthermore, the siddhi of the indivisible

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: is the nature of mahƒÅmudrƒÅ.

original: zhes so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin ni mi 'gal te rang bzhin dga' ba la phyag rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin ni mi 'gal te rang bzhin dga' ba la phyag rgya chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of the great seal is not contradictory, for the natural joy is called the great seal.

original: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The other is not like that.

original: de yang rang bzhin dga' ba ni dga' ba gang gi kyang reg par mi nus so //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin dga' ba ni dga' ba gang gi kyang reg par mi nus so //

original: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud las //
analyzed: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rgyud las //

original: gzhan gyis ma reg lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma reg lhan cig skyes //

original: gsum pos spangs pa'i gang rnyed de //
analyzed: gsum pos spangs pa'i gang rnyed de //

original: gsum gyi rang bzhin gsum dang bral //
analyzed: gsum gyi rang bzhin gsum dang bral //

original: de la ma reg lhan cig skyes //üîΩzhes gsungs se //

original: drug gi bde ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs drug shes rab dang bcas pa'o //

original: 'khor lo yi ni drug dbus bzhugs //

analyzed: gang gis tshangs pa'i drug pa zhes pa ni rin po che dang sangs rgyas kyi snod gnyis bde ba'i ye shes kyis rgyas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú By whom the sixth is BrahmƒÅ‚Äù means that the two vessels, the jewel and the buddha, are filled with the gnosis of bliss.

original: mdud pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: mdud pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: The knot is the knot of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa ni char yang bcu drug dang / dga' ba bcu drug gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa ni char yang bcu drug dang / dga' ba bcu drug gnas pa'o //

original: de la lte pa'i 'og tu 'pho ba bcu drug ni sngar bstan pa de @165a * //
analyzed: de la lte pa'i 'og tu 'pho ba bcu drug ni sngar bstan pa de @165a * //

original: thabs kyi lta ba'i 'og nas ni shes rab kyi lte bar 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi lta ba'i 'og nas ni shes rab kyi lte bar 'pho ba'o //
translated: From below the tip of the means, the bodhicitta moves to the tip of the wisdom.üîΩThe sixteen movements above

original: steng gi 'pho ba bcu drug ni //
analyzed: steng gi 'pho ba bcu drug ni //
translated: are the sixteen movements above the navel.

original: zhes pa ni slar la thabs kyi gnas su 'pho pa'i byang chub kyi sems thig le dang dga' ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa de ji srid gnas gyi  bar du ni dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni slar la thabs kyi gnas su 'pho pa'i byang chub kyi sems thig le dang dga' ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa de ji srid gnas gyi  bar du ni dus zhes bya'o //
translated: As such, the bodhicitta that moves again to the place of the means together with the bindu, joy, and so on is called ‚Äútime‚Äù for as long as it remains.

original: de yang 'di skad bshad de /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad bshad de /
translated: That is explained as follows.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang rlung gnyis phrad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thur du 'byung ba'i rlung gnyis dang bcas pa phrad pas ni rlung de yang dag dri med spros bral 'dor rab rang bzhin dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang rlung gnyis phrad pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni thur du 'byung ba'i rlung gnyis dang bcas pa phrad pas ni rlung de yang dag dri med spros bral 'dor rab rang bzhin dga' bar gyur to //
translated: the vƒÅyu becomes pure, stainless, free from proliferation, and naturally blissful.üîΩIn that ultimate nature, there is no transference,

analyzed: de lta bu'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin la ni 'pho ba ste steng 'og gcig pu'i zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: steng dang 'og la sogs pa'i 'pho ba ni de gcig pu ho na zhes pa'i don to /
translated: ‚Äú Transference of the upper and lower‚Äù means that there is no single one.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba'i zhes pa ni de rnams la de sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba'i zhes pa ni de rnams la de sbyor ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Application to the first‚Äù means applying to those.

original: ci'i phyir de la de sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la de sbyor zhe na /

original: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab ces pa la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: It is explained by ‚Äúmethod and wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam pa'i shes rab skye ba med pa la kun rdzob sgyu ma'i thabs khyad par can gyis sbyor ba las mchog gi ye shes dang / chad pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i shes rab skye ba med pa la kun rdzob sgyu ma'i thabs khyad par can gyis sbyor ba las mchog gi ye shes dang / chad pa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: From the application of ultimate nonarising wisdom with the special illusory relative method, the supreme pristine consciousness and the nondual application of the nature of annihilation are explained.

analyzed: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis ni go sla bas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The thirty-two channels are easy to understand, so they are not explained here.

original: sku dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs gsum 'khor lo dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sku dang zhes pa la sogs pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs gsum 'khor lo dang sbyar ro //

original: gcig pu rtog med ma zhes pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: gcig pu rtog med ma zhes pa ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: The single one, non-conceptual, is the emanation wheel.

original: yang srog gi dbyug pa ni sku'o //
analyzed: yang srog gi dbyug pa ni sku'o //
translated: Again, the life-rod is the body.

original: la na n'a ni gsung ngo //
analyzed: la na n'a ni gsung ngo //
translated: The lana is the speech.

original: ra sa n'a ni thugs so //
analyzed: ra sa n'a ni thugs so //
translated: The rasanƒÅ is the mind.

original: gcig pu rtog med pa ni sku gsung thugs gsum dang bral ba aa wa dh'um t'i'i rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: gcig pu rtog med pa ni sku gsung thugs gsum dang bral ba aa wa dh'um t'i'i rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: The single one, non-conceptual, is free from the three body, speech, and mind, and is the nature of the avadh≈´tƒ´, called ‚Äújoy.

original: / so sho mna' tshangs pa'i dbyug pa 'khyud nas zhes pa ni srog gi rtsa byang chub kyi sems kyis gang na gnas tsam na tshangs pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: ‚Äù Embracing the rod of Brahma, the soma, means that when the life channel is filled with bodhicitta, there is Brahma and so forth.

original: mi gnas tsam na ni de lta ma yin te srog gi dbyug pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas tsam na ni de lta ma yin te srog gi dbyug pa'o //
translated: When it is not filled, it is not like that.

original: bde ba chen po'i gtsug tor nas zhes pa ni spyi bo gtsug gi 'khor lo bde chen gyi thugs gnas so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i gtsug tor nas zhes pa ni spyi bo gtsug gi 'khor lo bde chen gyi thugs gnas so //
translated: From the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a of great bliss means the mind of great bliss dwelling in the head u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a wheel.

analyzed: bde ba chen po'i gtsug tor nor bu'i phor yo pa'o //

original: de yang shes rab ma'i dngos po'i kha rlung 'khor lo yan chad ces pa ni bde ba chen pos stong gi mtha' mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab ma'i dngos po'i kha rlung 'khor lo yan chad ces pa ni bde ba chen pos stong gi mtha' mtshon pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the upper end of the wheel of the wind of the reality of the wisdom woman is said to be the sign of the extreme of emptiness of great bliss.

original: rlung gis 'og gi mtha' mtshon pa ni bzung ba'i bar yang don gyis shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rlung gis 'og gi mtha' mtshon pa ni bzung ba'i bar yang don gyis shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The sign of the lower end of the wind is to be understood by implication as far as the retention.

original: ji ltar tsandan go shirsha'i shing la sprul chen po yod @165b pa'o zhes pa ni tsandan la ni shing yang yod de de gnyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i tshul du yod pa ni sprul gyis shing la 'khyud pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar tsandan go shirsha'i shing la sprul chen po yod @165b pa'o zhes pa ni tsandan la ni shing yang yod de de gnyis dbyer mi phyed pa'i tshul du yod pa ni sprul gyis shing la 'khyud pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is a great snake on the sandalwood tree, the sandalwood tree is also there, and they exist in a manner that is inseparable, just like the snake embracing the tree.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems khu ba dang bde ba gnyis kyang bye brag tu mi phyed par 'pho ba'i dus su bde ba'i ngo bo ro gcig par yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems khu ba dang bde ba gnyis kyang bye brag tu mi phyed par 'pho ba'i dus su bde ba'i ngo bo ro gcig par yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis ye shes zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the bodhicitta and the semen, both of which are bliss, are not differentiated, and at the time of emission, they exist as a single taste in the nature of bliss, which is explained as the natural gnosis.

original: tshangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa tshangs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa tshangs par byed pa'o //
translated: Brahma is the one who purifies the afflictions, etc. with correct pristine consciousness.

original: dbyug pa'i snying po ni yang dag pa'i ye shes de rtsa'i dbyug pa'i dbus na don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis dang ldan nas snying po bzhugs so //
analyzed: dbyug pa'i snying po ni yang dag pa'i ye shes de rtsa'i dbyug pa'i dbus na don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis dang ldan nas snying po bzhugs so //
translated: The essence of the staff is that the ultimate and the relative exist as the essence in the center of the staff of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s, endowed with correct pristine consciousness.

original: dang po zhes pa ni rtsa'i mdud pa dang tshes grangs la sogs pa bcu drug gi dang po'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes pa ni rtsa'i mdud pa dang tshes grangs la sogs pa bcu drug gi dang po'o //
translated: The first is the first of the sixteen, such as the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ knots and the lunar days.

original: zur gsum gyi rnam pa'i zhes pa ni rtsa'i dbyi bas zur gsum pa tshangs pa'i bu gnas padma'i dngos por yod pa'o //
analyzed: zur gsum gyi rnam pa'i zhes pa ni rtsa'i dbyi bas zur gsum pa tshangs pa'i bu gnas padma'i dngos por yod pa'o //
translated: The triangular shape is the triangular shape of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´ knot, which exists as the lotus of the brahma aperture.

original: de yang shes rab ma'i dngos po'i longs spyod rnams kyi dang po'i dga' bar bshad do //
analyzed: de yang shes rab ma'i dngos po'i longs spyod rnams kyi dang po'i dga' bar bshad do //
translated: Further, that is explained as the joy of the first of the enjoyments of the entity of wisdom.

original: 'dod pa 'dar ba zhes bya ba nas rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gnyis pa mchog gi dga' bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'dar ba zhes bya ba nas rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gnyis pa mchog gi dga' bar bshad do //
translated: The joy of the second is explained as the joy of the supreme from the desire of trembling up to the joy of the nature.

original: lte ba'i srog gi rlung zhes bya ba nas gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsum pa chad pa'i dga' ba bstan to //
analyzed: lte ba'i srog gi rlung zhes bya ba nas gsal ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsum pa chad pa'i dga' ba bstan to //
translated: The third, the joy of cessation, is taught by the line ‚Äúthe life-force wind at the navel‚Äù up to ‚Äúclarity.‚Äù

original: 'od kyi zhes bya ba nas thog gi zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bzhi pa rang bzhin dga' ba'i rnam grangs bstan to //
analyzed: 'od kyi zhes bya ba nas thog gi zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bzhi pa rang bzhin dga' ba'i rnam grangs bstan to //

original: yang na shes rab ma'i lte ba la sogs pa bzhis dga' ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: yang na shes rab ma'i lte ba la sogs pa bzhis dga' ba'i don bstan to //
translated: Alternatively, the four lines beginning ‚Äúthe navel of the wisdom woman‚Äù teach the meaning of joy.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa bzhin mchog gi dga' ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba la sogs pa bzhin mchog gi dga' ba bstan to //
translated: The four lines beginning ‚Äúthe joy of desire‚Äù teach the meaning of supreme joy.

original: srog dang zhes pa la sogs pa bzhis chad pa'i dga' pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: srog dang zhes pa la sogs pa bzhis chad pa'i dga' pa'i don bstan to //
translated: The four lines beginning ‚Äúthe life-force‚Äù teach the meaning of the joy of cessation.

original: 'od dang bya ba la sogs pa bzhis rang bzhin dga' ba'i don bstan to //
analyzed: 'od dang bya ba la sogs pa bzhis rang bzhin dga' ba'i don bstan to //
translated: The four lines beginning ‚Äúlight‚Äù teach the meaning of natural joy.

original: de ltar dbye bas drug cu rtsa bzhir dbye bar byas pas ni sprul pa'i thams cad dga' ba zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar dbye bas drug cu rtsa bzhir dbye bar byas pas ni sprul pa'i thams cad dga' ba zhes so //

analyzed: yang 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pas dga' ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Again, the synonyms of joy are taught by the lines beginning ‚Äúdesire‚Äù and so on.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog gi dga' ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mchog gi dga' ba'i rnam grangs so //

original: 'bar ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni chad pa'i dga' ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'bar ba zhes pa la sogs pa ni chad pa'i dga' ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: The so-called blazing and so forth are synonyms for the joy of cessation.

original: au ta zhes pa bzhi ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i ming gi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: au ta zhes pa bzhi ni rang bzhin dga' ba'i ming gi rnam grangs te /
translated: The four ut are synonyms for the joy of the nature.

original: de rnams 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i dga' ba'i dga' ba dang / 'dar ba zhes bya ba'i @166a * //
analyzed: de rnams 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i dga' ba'i dga' ba dang / 'dar ba zhes bya ba'i @166a * //
translated: Among them, the joy of desire is the joy of joy, the trembling

analyzed: mchog dga' ba dang / 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i chad dga' ba dang / dga' ba zhes bya ba'i dga' ba yang dga' ba'o //
translated: is the supreme joy, the going is the joy of cessation, and the joy is the joy of the joy of the nature.

original: gzhan rnams kyang de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyang de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood in the same way.

original: de ltar bzhir dbye ba dang rnam grangs kyi dbye bas bcu drug tu yang dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhir dbye ba dang rnam grangs kyi dbye bas bcu drug tu yang dbye ba'o //

original: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'pho ba bcu drug dang / thun chod brgyad dang / skad cig ma bzhi la sogs pa'i yang dag yang 'di rnams su bshad do //
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / 'pho ba bcu drug dang / thun chod brgyad dang / skad cig ma bzhi la sogs pa'i yang dag yang 'di rnams su bshad do //
translated: The sixty-four finger lengths, the thirty-two nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s, the sixteen movements, the eight periods, the four moments, and so on are explained as the pure, pure mundane gnosis.

original: de ltar bsdus nas bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus nas bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the concise explanation,

original: 'di nas mar phyed nas bshad do //
analyzed: 'di nas mar phyed nas bshad do //
translated: from here on, the extensive explanation will be explained.

original: zur gsum la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zur gsum la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: sngar bstan pas zur gsum 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pas zur gsum 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: Since it was explained previously, the three corners are not explained here.

original: shes rab ma'i zhes pa ni sbyor thabs rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab ma'i zhes pa ni sbyor thabs rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan to //
translated: The ‚Äúwisdom woman‚Äù is explained as the various methods of union.

original: lta bas ni de rnams la dga' ba skye bas rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta bas ni de rnams la dga' ba skye bas rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: Since the view is the cause of the arising of joy in those,

original: 'dod pa shes pa ni shes rab ma la 'dod pa ste dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa shes pa ni shes rab ma la 'dod pa ste dga' ba'o //
translated: the ‚Äúknowledge of desire‚Äù is the desire, or joy, of the wisdom woman.

original: srog gi rlung ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'i rlung du bshad do //
analyzed: srog gi rlung ni byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'i rlung du bshad do //
translated: The ‚Äúvital wind‚Äù is explained as the wind that possesses bodhicitta.

original: zla ba stod kyi zhes pa ni mar ngo la sogs dang bral ba ni tshes dang po'i zla ba tshes gcig pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba stod kyi zhes pa ni mar ngo la sogs dang bral ba ni tshes dang po'i zla ba tshes gcig pa'o //

analyzed: de yang zla ba dang mtshungs pa'i ye shes su chu tshod gcig gi bar du ni ye shes de ni par de tsam du gnas pa'i bar ro //
translated: Moreover, the gnosis that is like the moon abides for just that long, for one period of time.

original: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par khu ba der 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam par khu ba der 'brel pa ste /
